title: 38 IT firms apply to make laptops, PCs under PLI scheme
selftext:
Asus, Dell, HP and Foxconn are among 38 companies that have submitted applications to manufacture laptops, personal computers and servers in India under the Centre’s production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme for IT hardware. Apple, however, has opted to skip participation in the scheme.

indianexpress.com/article/business/commodities/38-it-firms-apply-to-make-laptops-pcs-under-pli-scheme-8916898/
comments: Is this just a mobile version of assembling in India or is it more?
You technically could manufacture the frame/chassis in India once you get the design from the ODM but I think this will just be assembly for now.
Similar to how car manufacturing start with assembly in India
